title: 1263-A
statement: A. Sweet Problemtime limit per test1 secondmemory limit per test256 megabytesinputstandard inputoutputstandard outputYou have three piles of candies: red, green and blue candies:the first pile contains only red candies and there are $$$r$$$ candies in it,the second pile contains only green candies and there are $$$g$$$ candies in it,the third pile contains only blue candies and there are $$$b$$$ candies in it.Each day Tanya eats exactly two candies of different colors. She is free to choose the colors of eaten candies: the only restriction that she can't eat two candies of the same color in a day.Find the maximal number of days Tanya can eat candies? Each day she needs to eatexactlytwo candies.InputThe first line contains integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \\le t \\le 1000$$$) — the number of test cases in the input. Then $$$t$$$ test cases follow.Each test case is given as a separate line of the input. It contains three integers $$$r$$$, $$$g$$$ and $$$b$$$ ($$$1 \\le r, g, b \\le 10^8$$$) — the number of red, green and blue candies, respectively.OutputPrint $$$t$$$ integers: the $$$i$$$-th printed integer is the answer on the $$$i$$$-th test case in the input.ExampleInput6 1 1 1 1 2 1 4 1 1 7 4 10 8 1 4 8 2 8Output1 2 2 10 5 9NoteIn the first example, Tanya can eat candies for one day only. She can eat any pair of candies this day because all of them have different colors.In the second example, Tanya can eat candies for two days. For example, she can eat red and green candies on the first day, and green and blue candies on the second day.In the third example, Tanya can eat candies for two days. For example, she can eat red and green candies on the first day, and red and blue candies on the second day. Note, that two red candies will remain uneaten.

You have three piles of candies: red, green, and blue.  There are $r$ red candies, $g$ green candies, and $b$ blue candies.  

Each day, you eat exactly two candies of different colors. What is the maximum number of days you can eat candies?

Input:

The first line contains the number of test cases, $t$.

Each test case is a line with three integers: $r$, $g$, and $b$.

Output:

Print $t$ integers, one for each test case. Each integer is the maximum number of days candies can be eaten for that test case.

You have three piles of items: red, green, and blue.  Each pile has a different number of items.  You can take two items each day, but they must be different colors.  Find the maximum number of days you can take items.
